TopicTitle: how to get sub assembly to work right

Articles.Content: So i downloaded a aircraft carrier and i want to put some tanks that i build into the carrier but every time i try to use sub assembly to attach the tank to a docking port it doesn't connect using the docking port on my tank, instead it just merges my tank with the carrier.  what am doing wrong or how do i connect the to so i can drop the tank out of the carrier it would be nice if someone could help me out .

For a subassembly to be attachable, its attach point needs to be an open connector node on the root part of the subassembly.  So when you're building a subassembly, start by placing the part-you-want-to-attach-by first (so it'll be the root part) and then build everything else from there.  Or, if you already have some subassemblies you've built and their root parts aren't what they need to be, you can change the root part by using the "re-root" tool ("4" key in the vehicle editor, by default).

14 minutes ago, Snark said:

For a subassembly to be attachable, its attach point needs to be an open connector node on the root part of the subassembly.  So when you're building a subassembly, start by placing the part-you-want-to-attach-by first (so it'll be the root part) and then build everything else from there.  Or, if you already have some subassemblies you've built and their root parts aren't what they need to be, you can change the root part by using the "re-root" tool ("4" key in the vehicle editor, by default).

thank you! ive been scratching my head trying to figure this one out. now that i got the figured out. how do i control my tank once i undock it? i undocked it but it wont let me control it. im sorry im a fairly new to the game

3 hours ago, banko13 said:

thank you! ive been scratching my head trying to figure this one out. now that i got the figured out. how do i control my tank once i undock it? i undocked it but it wont let me control it.

Well, first, make sure that the tank either has a crewmember aboard, or else it has a probe core-- otherwise it's not a controllable ship.

If you do have either crew or a probe core, then it may just be that you need to "switch" to it.  KSP only lets you control one ship at a time, so if you have a ship and undock something from it, you can't control both.  Generally the game will leave control with the "mothership", though it can be a bit unpredictable.

If you have two ships that are nearby each other (within 2.3 kilometers), you can easily switch back and forth between them using the [ and ] keys.
